[
Given the partisan divide, the documentary probably will be of interest only to people who already admire Justice Ginsburg, but it's a good story that will inspire many and should appeal to anyone with an open mind.
,
A satisfyingly thorough portrait of the phenomenal octogenarian who has become a popular cultural icon among Millennials.
,
Opening with a flurry of disparaging remarks denoting the type of obstacles faced by their subject, Julie Cohen and Betsy West quickly shift gears for their affectionate and affecting portrait of Ruth Bader Ginsberg
,
Ginsburg is a woman we instinctively want to know more about, and RBG gives us that chance.
,
A celebration of the scrunchie-wearing octogenarian not just as a pop-culture folk hero and millennial meme but as a wife, a warrior, and a true iconoclast, famed for her fierce legal mind and the cutting wit of her dissenting opinions.
,
RBG convincingly argues that Ginsburg herself is a figure worth admiring, whether or not you agree with her politics and whether or not you like those memes.
,
RBG takes various facets of a fascinating life and stitches them together, as documentaries go, into a genuine beauty.
,
While it may gloss over some aspects of Ginsburg's life, we've never seen as intimate a portrait of the usually private justice.
,
No topic gets more than a cursory overview in Julie Cohen and Betsy West's breathlessly superficial, school-presentation-ish documentary.
,
[A] lively and thorough profile...
,
As an architect of modern feminism, Ruth Bader Ginsburg deserves accolades, but that's all this glossy and thin lionization has to offer.
,
A marvelous, funny, deeply moving biography of Ruth Bader Ginsberg from her rise as a legal champion of women's rights in the 1970s to her ascension as a Supreme Court justice and social-media hero "Notorious RBG.'
,
The film rarely presents a clear analysis of Ruth Bader Ginsburg's victories, reducing her work to empty slogans.
,
This is more than just the predictable story of who Ginsburg was and who she has become. It's also a monument to the formal written legal legacy that transcends her own life story and changed a nation.
,
It's an engrossing, sometimes quite moving story...
,
RBG doesn't break any new ground in terms of filmmaking style, and it gets a little distracted with trivia like her love of opera or her workout routine. But it's a good summation of a brilliant career.
,
A chronology of Ginsberg's subsequent victories shows how patiently and shrewdly she worked to establish the existence and pernicious effects of sex discrimination
,
Intimate without being obtrusive, RBG doesn't exactly demystify the Supreme Court so much as it brings us closer to one of its greats.
,
Regardless of your political ideology, you'll come away with a newfound respect for the tireless pioneer of gender equality.
,
This spry celebration reveals that the real Ginsburg is neither beast nor badass, but an even-tempered, soft-spoken mediator-not typically the traits that inspire rousing high-fives
